snippet.title: GE launches 'microfactory' to co-create the future of manufacturing
snippet.description: GE has launched FirstBuild, a microfactory and open community space in Louisville, Kentucky for students, makers, and engineers to co-create the smart appliances of the future.

snippet.title: NBA CIO Michael Gliedman: Innovation chief. Video maestro. Musician.
snippet.description: Michael Gliedman, CIO of the NBA, talks to TechRepublic about his passion for basketball, music, and pushing the limits of technology.

snippet.title: The missing link in 3D printing: User-friendly software
snippet.description: One of the biggest obstacles for 3D printing is its unintuitive CAD software. To gain mass appeal, the process has to become more user-friendly with simpler tools.

snippet.title: Rooting your Kindle Fire: a cautionary tale concluded
snippet.description: Learn how a supposedly bricked Kindle Fire was resuscitated in the second part of a discussion on how to root it and install the full Android operating system.

snippet.title: White House attacks climate change with hackathons, crowdsourcing, and big data
snippet.description: Accessible climate data from the government is allowing tech enthusiasts to be on the front lines of the fight against climate change.

snippet.title: How open climate data can improve community resilience against climate change
snippet.description: Read how releasing open data supports the federal government's goal of improving community resilience against climate change and primes the pump for meaningful reuse by tech giants...

snippet.title: Nelly Yusupova: CTO. Entrepreneur. Risk-taker. Movement-starter.
snippet.description: Webgrrls CTO and tech entrepreneur Nelly Yusupova tells TechRepublic about her journey to becoming a leader for women in technology and the importance of taking risks.

snippet.title: Microsoft's redemption song in Africa: Catalyzing grassroots tech revolutions on the world's least connected continent
snippet.description: Africans are taking control of their own destiny in technology, and Microsoft is no longer just giving away software but using its resources to fuel innovation fires instead.

snippet.title: Memes pwn the web: What Lolcatz, Tron Guy, and Doge tell us about ourselves and the future of humanity
snippet.description: If you want to know how memes came to dominate the web, how they may evolve into "temes," and why they may hold the secret to the future of life on earth, then you better read this...

snippet.title: Speed wins the startups game, according to entrepreneur Howard Tullman
snippet.description: Howard Tullman has been called "the most accomplished, best-connected entrepreneur you have never heard of." We recap his keynote from CEC Forecast about six tech trends to watch.
